Expectation1: Adhere to professional standards and operational protocols.
Situation1: An email has arrived with an optional sign-up for a future professional development seminar, and you should respond to that.
Expectation2: Provide spiritual guidance and counseling to individuals in need
Situation2: A member of the community has scheduled an appointment to discuss a persistent personal struggle.
Story: I sat in the operator’s break room, the hum of the subway echoing faintly through the walls. My phone buzzed with an email from the transit authority—an optional sign-up for a professional development seminar. They encouraged us to participate, to show commitment to our roles and keep up with the latest safety protocols. I knew my supervisor would notice who responded promptly. As I started to draft my reply, my other phone vibrated. It was a reminder: Mrs. Kim, a member of my congregation, was arriving soon for her appointment. She’d confided in me last Sunday about her ongoing struggle with loneliness, and I’d promised to listen, to be present for her. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in—one demanding my professional diligence, the other my compassion and presence. My fingers hovered over the keyboard, my mind torn between the expectations of my uniform and my collar, knowing I couldn’t give both my full attention at the same time.
